metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3144 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability stemming from failure to properly clean up closed OMAPI connections can lead to exhaustion of the pool of socket descriptors available to the DHCP server. Affects ISC DHCP 4.1.0 to 4.1-ESV-R15, 4.2.0 to 4.2.8, 4.3.0 to 4.3.6. Older versions may also be affected but are well beyond their end-of-life (EOL). Releases prior to 4.1.0 have not been tested.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
isc-dhcp-client-ddns - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
isc-dhcp-common - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
isc-dhcp-server - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.3.5-3ubuntu5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> DoS over OMAPI port only, see ISC kb article for workarounds, or properly limit access to ports

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.5-3ubuntu5').
